articles.headline: President, at Service, Hails Fort Hood’s Fallen
articles.snippet: President Obama took on the role of national eulogist on Tuesday for the first time since assuming office.
articles.abstract: President Obama took on the role of national eulogist on Tuesday for the first time since assuming office.
articles.lead_paragraph: FORT HOOD, Tex.  President Obama took on the role of national eulogist on Tuesday for the first time since assuming office as he led the country in mourning 13 active and retired soldiers gunned down not on a foreign battlefield but here on their home post by one of their own.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Clifford Krauss

articles.headline: Senate Plan Would Expand Regulation of Risky Lending
articles.snippet: Senator Christopher J. Dodd’s plan, a dramatic overhaul of financial regulation, has met with resistance from Republicans and business interests.
articles.abstract: Senator Christopher J. Dodd’s plan, a dramatic overhaul of financial regulation, has met with resistance from Republicans and business interests.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The chairman of the Senate banking committee proposed a financial overhaul on Tuesday that included consolidating bank regulators, creating a consumer financial protection agency and imposing new restraints on exotic financial instruments and credit rating agencies.

articles.headline: Cultural Bent Hangs Over Oracle’s Battle for Sun
articles.snippet: While American technology companies often say European regulators know little about technology, the Europeans cast the Americans as bullies.
articles.abstract: While American technology companies often say European regulators know little about technology, the Europeans cast the Americans as bullies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Oracle’s battle with European regulators over its acquisition of Sun Microsystems boils down to a conflict about the importance of free software and the government’s role in protecting it.
articles.byline: By Steve Lohr and James Kanter

articles.headline: 2 Bear Stearns Fund Leaders Are Acquitted
articles.snippet: A jury found that two managers did not lie by presenting an upbeat picture while their funds plummeted in value.
articles.abstract: A jury found that two managers did not lie by presenting an upbeat picture while their funds plummeted in value.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was, prosecutors claimed, a clear case of Wall Street crime  and a chance to bring to account two culprits of the subprime age.
articles.byline: By Zachery Kouwe and Dan Slater

articles.headline: Blackwater Said to Pursue Bribes to Iraq After 17 Died
articles.snippet: Former executives said it was unclear if payoffs of about $1 million were made to Iraqi officials, but the goal was to hush criticism and buy support after 17 civilians were killed.
articles.abstract: Former executives said it was unclear if payoffs of about $1 million were made to Iraqi officials, but the goal was to hush criticism and buy support after 17 civilians were killed.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Top executives at Blackwater Worldwide authorized secret payments of about $1 million to Iraqi officials that were intended to silence their criticism and buy their support after a September 2007 episode in which Blackwater security guards fatally shot 17 Iraqi civilians in Baghdad, according to former company officials.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and James Risen

articles.headline: Recession Upends German Zeal for Fiscal Prudence
articles.snippet: Germany’s leaders are grappling with a rising budget deficit as they push a tax cut to stimulate the economy.
articles.abstract: Germany’s leaders are grappling with a rising budget deficit as they push a tax cut to stimulate the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: It has come to this: Germany will almost certainly have a bigger budget deficit next year than Italy will.
articles.byline: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Judy Dempsey

articles.headline: Online Ads Are Booming, if They’re Attached to a Video
articles.snippet: With advertising dollars in mind, sites like MSNBC and even newspaper Web sites are giving video higher priority on their home pages.
articles.abstract: With advertising dollars in mind, sites like MSNBC and even newspaper Web sites are giving video higher priority on their home pages.
articles.lead_paragraph: News Web sites are starting to look a lot less like newspapers and a lot more like television.

articles.headline: Calming the Black Friday Crowds
articles.snippet: After a trampling death last year at one of its stores, Wal-Mart has overhauled its crowd-control measures.
articles.abstract: After a trampling death last year at one of its stores, Wal-Mart has overhauled its crowd-control measures.
articles.lead_paragraph: A year after an unruly crowd trampled a worker to death at a Wal-Mart store, the nation’s retailers are preparing for another Black Friday, the blockbuster shopping day after Thanksgiving. Along with offering $300 laptops and $99 navigation devices, stores are planning new safety measures to make sure the festive day does not take another deadly turn.

articles.headline: From Justice Kennedy, a Lesson in Journalism
articles.snippet: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy insisted on pre-approving a school newspaper article about a talk he gave at a Manhattan high school.
articles.abstract: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy insisted on pre-approving a school newspaper article about a talk he gave at a Manhattan high school.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The school newspaper at Dalton, a private school in Manhattan, contained a cryptic note from its editors last Friday.

articles.headline: Under Attack, Fed Chief Studies Politics
articles.snippet: As the Federal Reserve has come under scrutiny, Ben S. Bernanke, its chairman, is nurturing political ties.
articles.abstract: As the Federal Reserve has come under scrutiny, Ben S. Bernanke, its chairman, is nurturing political ties.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  With the Federal Reserve under more intense attack than at any time in decades, Ben S. Bernanke, the professorial chairman of the central bank, was schooled last month in how to handle the increased political demands of his job.

articles.headline: Falling Far Short of Reform
articles.snippet: Overhauling the health care system means making it more efficient, saving lives and giving Americans a long overdue raise. But the House bill won’t meet these goals.
articles.abstract: Overhauling the health care system means making it more efficient, saving lives and giving Americans a long overdue raise. But the House bill won’t meet these goals.
